post_text:
Can you believe the first 6 weeks of school is half over? If you would like to change your child's learning plans for the second 6 weeks, please fill out the Instructional Plan Transition Form by 10 a.m. Monday, September 21st. This form only needs to be completed if you would like to switch between virtual instruction to face-to-face or vice versa.

The form, along with additional information regarding textbooks, technology, transportation, and orientation, can be found below:
https://tinyurl.com/yxougetn
#TakeFlightJISD🦉
***
¿Puedes creer que las primeras 6 semanas de clases han terminado a la mitad?

Si desea cambiar los planes de aprendizaje de su hijo durante las segundas 6 semanas, complete el Formulario de transición del plan de instrucción antes de las 10 a.m. del lunes 21 de septiembre. Este formulario solo debe completarse si desea cambiar de instrucción virtual a cara a cara o viceversa.

El formulario, junto con información adicional sobre libros de texto, tecnología, transporte y orientación, se puede encontrar a continuación: https://tinyurl.com/yxougetn

post_text:
🚨JISD ATHLETIC TICKETING AND SPECTATOR UPDATE🚨 Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, JISD will be changing ticketing and spectator procedures to extracurricular events in accordance with TEA and the UIL to ensure the safety of all athletes, coaches and spectators. Please click the link below and read carefully, as there will only be a limited number of tickets per game. For those who are unable to attend games, JISD will livestream all middle school and high school contests. All procedures are subject to change following TEA, UIL, CDC and district policies.
Find out more ➡️ https://www.joshuaisd.org/Page/14801
#OFND #TakeFlightJISD

post_text:
🏈The Owl Football squad will play a scrimmage Thursday in Granbury. Below is information on game times, bus departures and arrivals:

Freshmen begin at 5:30 pm and the bus will leave Joshua at 3:30 pm. Arrival back to Joshua expected around 7:45 pm.

JV will start at 6:45 pm and end at 7:45. Departure time will be 4:45 and arrival back to Joshua is expected around 9.

Varsity will kick-off at 8 pm and the departure bus will be at 6. They are expected back around 11 pm.

Due to COVID-19 restrictions set by GISD, fans will not be allowed in the stadium.
#OFND🦉 #TakeFlightJISD

post_text:
💸MORE BANG FOR YOUR BUCK: Joshua ISD has been ranked by WalletHub as the 10th most equitable school district out of 1,020 in Texas! WalletHub scored districts based on two metrics: average household income and expenditures for public elementary and secondary schools per pupil.

“This is further proof that all students in Joshua ISD, no matter their background, have an equal opportunity to a great education,” said JISD Superintendent Fran Marek. “This in turn helps close achievement gaps and allows all of our students an equal chance to become productive citizens in society.” #TakeFlightJISD
https://wallethub.com/edu/e/most-least-equitable-school-districts-in-texas/77134/

post_text:
Mobile hotspots have finally arrived! Parents who completed the hotspot application online will receive an email today with further instructions.
Hot spots will be distributed to qualified families as follows:
1. Students that qualify as economically disadvantaged
2. Students in the Associate Degree program
3. Seniors
4. Families with multiple students in VIP

Hotspots can be picked up on Tuesday, Sept. 1 from 7-9 am or 4-6 pm on the visitor side of Owl Stadium. If you cannot make it, you may pick them up from the Technology Center (720 Broadway) daily from 1-3 pm.

If you do not receive an email, but need a hotspot, please complete the form, which can be found by clicking below. Students must participate in the Virtual Instruction Plan in order to be considered for a hotspot.
https://tinyurl.com/y5sa46xr
#TakeFlightJISD

post_text: We are so excited to open our schools tomorrow and kickoff the 2020-21 school year! Our leaders have worked tirelessly over the last four months for this moment, and we cannot wait to see our students and parents again! Students, make sure you get plenty of rest, a hearty breakfast, and get ready to engage in learning! Remember to wear your masks as we get ready to #TakeFlight together! Share your First Day photos by emailing them to jiscommunications@joshuaisd.org. #TakeFlightJISD

🏌️‍♂️Come tee off with us on October 12th for our 8th Annual Joshua ISD Education Foundation Golf Tournament at Hidden Creek Golf Course! Registration will be open until October 2nd, and will include lunch, gift bag, mulligans, a chance at a hole-in-one. We will also have prizes and much more! All proceeds will go to the Foundation and provide students and teachers field trips, innovative programs, and more! #TakeFlight

*Tournament is subject to change due to COVID-19 requirements.

post_text:
Technology questions? We've got answers. The JISD
Technology Department has created a new one-stop resource to help answer questions and assist parents or students that need technical assistance for virtual instruction.

The site includes information on getting started before going virtual, understanding how Classlink works, Chromebook basics, accessibility guide for Chromebooks and G Suite, troubleshooting, and Chromebook technical assistance. It also has parent resources, as well as information for elementary and secondary students. All information is available in Spanish as well.

Please note that the getting started guide must be completed before the first day of school on Monday. If anyone still needs assistance, a support ticket can be filled out on the site, and a technology representative will be in touch as soon as possible. #TakeFlight

bit.ly/jisd20

post_text:
Parents: Joshua ISD sent out postcards to families that registered for bus transportation services earlier this week. We encourage parents to please check their mail to get their bus route information, as our first day of school will be this coming Monday, August 31st. If you registered after August 20th, bus transportation will not be provided in time for the first week of school. Parents can contact their campus registrar to get set up for bus transportation. All other questions can be sent to the Transportation interest area on Let's Talk!#TakeFlight

Keep spreading the word! Joshua ISD is still accepting interdistrict transfer applications! JISD has five open spots for each grade level from Kindergarten to 5th Grade at Plum Creek Elementary School, 10 spots for each grades 6-8 at Loflin Middle School, and an unlimited number of spots for grades 9-12 at Joshua High School, for students outside of the district interested in enrolling.

post_text:
UPDATE:Out of an abundance of caution, football workouts scheduled for tomorrow morning at the MPAC will also be canceled and resume on Monday, July 20.

All other student-athlete workouts at Owl Stadium will resume on Monday, July 20.
***
🚨🚨Due to the safety and well-being of everyone involved, Joshua ISD will be temporarily suspending the Alpha Owl strength and conditioning workouts at Owl Stadium only, after a student-athlete tested positive for COVID-19. The student will now self-quarantine for two weeks. Although participants were socially distant at all times, coaches and all other athletes who may have come in close contact have been notified.

Joshua ISD does not have any workouts scheduled for July 6-10, per UIL guidelines. All athletic facilities and equipment will be thoroughly sanitized and deep cleaned during this break. Alpha Owl workouts at the stadium will resume July 15.

Alpha Owl workouts for the JHS Football team at the Multipurpose Athletic Complex (MPAC) will continue as scheduled this week, and resume again on July 13.
text:
UPDATE:Out of an abundance of caution, football workouts scheduled for tomorrow morning at the MPAC will also be canceled and resume on Monday, July 20.

All other student-athlete workouts at Owl Stadium will resume on Monday, July 20.
***
🚨🚨Due to the safety and well-being of everyone involved, Joshua ISD will be temporarily suspending the Alpha Owl strength and conditioning workouts at Owl Stadium only, after a student-athlete tested positive for COVID-19. The student will now self-quarantine for two weeks. Although participants were socially distant at all times, coaches and all other athletes who may have come in close contact have been notified.

Joshua ISD does not have any workouts scheduled for July 6-10, per UIL guidelines. All athletic facilities and equipment will be thoroughly sanitized and deep cleaned during this break. Alpha Owl workouts at the stadium will resume July 15.

Alpha Owl workouts for the JHS Football team at the Multipurpose Athletic Complex (MPAC) will continue as scheduled this week, and resume again on July 13.

text:
Join the Owl Family! Joshua ISD will be accepting interdistrict applications for any families outside of JISD interested in joining our A-Rated district, beginning Monday, July 13th at 8 a.m. Applications must be submitted online only. JISD will be accepting five spots for each grade level from Kindergarten to 5th Grade at Plum Creek Elementary School, 10 spots for each grade 6-8 at Loflin Middle School, and an unlimited number of spots for grades 9-12 at Joshua High School, pending application approval.

Applications will be on a first-come, first-served basis and will be time-stamped before being placed on a waiting list to be reviewed.

Applications and required documents can be found below. #OFND #JoshuaStrong

https://tinyurl.com/ybdu9eor

post_text:
Joshua ISD is continuing to plan for the 2020-21 school year and waiting on guidance from the Texas Education Agency. As part of our planning, we would greatly appreciate your feedback to help us better prepare for both an in-person and virtual learning curriculum. We would like to establish a clear breakdown of the needs of our families based on your child's campus and grade level.

Our goal in running this Thoughtexchange is to gain your feedback to better distinguish and understand the needs of every campus regarding in-person and virtual learning. Once we evaluate your feedback, district leaders will formulate a comprehensive plan that addresses student's needs. This plan will be announced once finalized.

Please share your thoughts and rate between 15-30 thoughts in this conversation. This Thoughtexchange will be open until 5 pm, Monday, June 29, 2020.

If you have more than 3 children in JISD, please submit a second survey.

Thank you so much for your participation! Your time and feedback are extremely valuable.

https://my.thoughtexchange.com/scroll/948203360

During Monday's regularly-scheduled Board of Trustees meeting, the Joshua ISD Board approved a revised calendar for the 2020-21 school year. This calendar includes make-up days for possible school closures due to COVID-19, and are indicated in blue. In the event that the district closes in April or May, then time will be made up by adding one hour to each day for 10 days in addition to the designated blue days. This calendar was approved by the Owl Pride Committee composed of teachers on June 8th. 🗓
https://tinyurl.com/ycumxokk

post_text:
The annual Joshua ISD Staff Appreciation event was a perfect night, as we honored several district students, staff and administrators! 17 graduates that earned Employee Scholarships were recognized, along with Teachers of the Year, Support Staff of the Year, and Education Foundation Grant recipients. We also awarded pins to employees that have served 5, 10, 15, 20, 25 years or more (including Superintendent Marek, who completed her 30th year in JISD.) And we said one final thank you to 21 employees who are retiring! The grand prize was awarded to Master Chief Charles Linville from Joshua High School, who had the highest bid in our silent auction for will, courtesy of Leasor Crass.

Stay tuned as we continue to highlight all of the individuals that were recognized

Thank you, Owl Nation staff, for everything you do to help our students succeed! #OFND #JoshuaStrong

post_text:
Due to uncertainty regarding COVID-19, the following changes have been made to the 2020-21 Joshua High football schedule:

-Midnight Madness has been canceled

-Hoot Owl-ley, originally scheduled for August 28th, has been canceled

-The October 2nd home game against Mansfield Timberview will be designated as Military/First Responders Appreciation Night, Pink Out/Pee Wee Night, Elementary and Middle School Night

-The Homecoming game has been moved to October 16th against Arlington Seguin. Homecoming festivities will include the Hall of Fame and Wall of Fame induction ceremonies.

These decisions were made out of an abundance of caution, as these events require much planning. To see the updated schedule, click below. #OFND

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1TUeiYVpAGPC1Ez0kkDeSEWf5whenK_m3vb2dLUe8NF8/edit#gid=1092787134

post_text:
The JISD School and Public Library remains closed at this time, but please stay tuned for information on an opening date. In the meantime, we are offering virtual opportunities such as the Summer Reading Program and North Texas Libraries on the Go!

All overdue fines accrued during this closure will be forgiven. Library books and DVDs can be put in the outside book drop Library staff is available to take calls Monday-Thursday from 9 am-4 pm to assist families with ebook accounts and answer any other questions. All updates and additional library information can be found at www.joshualibrary.org or by calling 817-202-2547.

We are only one day away from graduation for the Joshua High School Class of 2020! To help alleviate traffic, please see the below parking maps on how to enter and exit Owl Stadium based on where families were assigned seating. Families that did not fill out the online health screening questionnaire must fill out a paper copy before entering the stadium.

Students that need to be dropped off can do so by going to lot #5, which is on the north side of the visitor parking lot.

The livestream will be available on the JISD Facebook page, and the VYPE Texas link below:
http://vypelive.com/web/g/8960

We'll see you at 8 pm on Saturday! #OFND #JoshuaStrong #JHSClassof20

post_text: Congrats to all of our Owl Soccer players selected, along with Coach Thad Goodling for being named Coach of the Year! #OFND #JoshuaStrong 💪
shared_text:
CLEBURNETIMESREVIEW.COM
Owls’ 4 selections lead AJC boys soccer superlatives

Joshua Owls Soccer
May 23 at 9:32 PM ·

A great article on the All Johnson County soccer superlatives, which include Griffin Gayler, All-County MVP; Nolan Walker, Defensive Player of the Year; Mario Miranda, Goalkeeper of the Year; and our very own Coach Goodling, Coach of the Year!

Additionally, Daniel Lopez, Riley McFarland and Deaven Connelly were named to the AJC 1st Team, and Seth Rasmussen, Matt Roberson and Trevin Gayler were named to the 2nd Team. Congratulations on these well-deserved honors!🦉⚽️

It's a great day to be an Owl! Today, we got to honor our Class of 2020 Graduates with a parade in front of hundreds of staff and community members at Joshua High School and New Horizon High. The seniors then got to parade around their home elementary campus they attended and were recognized by many of their former teachers. Congratulations, c/o 2020! We'll see you at Graduation! #OFND #JoshuaStrong 🦉🎓

post_text:
Joshua ISD is excited to partner with VYPE Texas to livestream graduation ceremonies for both New Horizon High School and Joshua High School!

The livestream will be available on the Vype Events page and
will begin a few minutes before each graduation. The stream will also be airing on the JISD Facebook page. Both streams will stay online and be archived once the events are over. Families wishing to purchase a DVD copy of the JHS graduation can do so by visiting the Vype Shop and requesting a copy after the ceremony.

(Note: New Horizon will have another vendor that will be creating and distributing DVD copies.)

New Horizon Graduation link: http://vypelive.com/web/g/8959

Joshua High School link: http://vypelive.com/web/g/89

students and staff decided to create a slideshow of their
Senior artwork as a way to have a digital showcase so
that those students still get to shine.

We are so proud of these students, and know they have bright futures ahead! #OFND #JoshuaStrong

post_text:
The Joshua ISD Board of Trustees unanimously voted to hire three district administrators during the regularly-scheduled meeting on Monday.

Corey Hickerson was hired as the Chief of Administrative Services, and will oversee several departments.

Tanya Chernow was approved to become the next Principal at Caddo Grove Elementary, and has spent the last three years in Joshua ISD.

Jennifer Leonard is the newest Assistant Principal at Plum Creek Elementary.

Learn more about our newest leaders below! 👏
https://tinyurl.com/y8v839zj

post_text: Joshua High School leaders have finalized plans for the Modified Senior Walk, which will be a drive-by parade for the Class of 2020 on Friday, May 22 at 10 am! Please see the below map of the parade route. District and campus staff will be showing their support. Visitors are encouraged to park at the Owl Stadium home and visitor parking lots. All participants must adhere to social distancing guidelines and remain at least six feet apart during the entirety of the event. We also encourage everyone to wear masks during the parade. #OFND #JoshuaStrong

post_text:
Joshua ISD leaders are preparing to proceed as normal for the 2020-21 school year. However, we know there is still a lot of uncertainty ahead and are making contingency plans for school learning. As part of our preparation, we would like to hear from you on how you would like your child/children taught? This is in an effort to provide various teaching options for families to choose from. Please complete one survey for each child. The survey will remain open until this Friday.
https://my.thoughtexchange.com/scroll/373750663

***

Los líderes del distrito de Joshua se están preparando para proceder normalmente para el año escolar 2020-21. Sin embargo, sabemos que todavía hay mucha incertidumbre por delante y estamos haciendo planes de contingencia para el aprendizaje escolar. Como parte de nuestra preparación, ¿nos gustaría saber de usted cómo le gustaría que le enseñen a su hijo(a)? Esto es en un esfuerzo por proporcionar varias opciones de enseñanza para que las familias elijan. Por favor complete una encuesta por cada niño.
https://my.thoughtexchange.com/scroll/373750663

🚨🚨We know the last few months have been difficult for the Joshua ISD community, and that you have many questions and concerns. That is why JISD is excited to announce a partnership with K12 Insight to launch Let's Talk! Let's Talk! is a two-way communication tool that streamlines all questions, concerns, comments, and compliments into one efficient system. Dialogues will be sent to district administrator that can best respond with accurate information in one business day! 🗣
🗞FULL STORY: https://tinyurl.com/y77hzuqn

shared_text:
Teachers Can
May 4 at 2:04 AM ·

Thirty nine events — that's what we have planned to honor teachers during this Teacher Appreciation Week. All of the events will be livestreamed at TeachersCan.org/events, unless indicated otherwise there. And get some sleep , because your schedule of events starts at 7:30 each morning, including tomorrow. You don't have to be a teacher to participate, but we are doing this specifically to pay tribute to our awesome Texas teachers.

Which event(s) are you most looking forward to?

#TeachersCan #ThankATeacher

Joshua ISD students and teachers: Whether you are just learning to sound out words, about to graduate, or teaching others, a strong reading foundation is crucial in life. JISD's Read to Me initiative strives to strengthen this skill and create meaningful connections by allowing kindergartners, seniors, and teachers to share a video of themselves reading a picture book. Click here for detailed instructions: https://bit.ly/jisdreadtome

Follow this link to take part: https://flipgrid.com/jisdreadtome

You must have a student or teacher email in order to participate. All videos will be reviewed before they are posted. 📘👀

post_text: It is Senior Spotlight time! Now that campuses will officially be closed for the remainder of the school year, we would like to highlight some of the accomplishments from the Class of 2020! If you have a student at Joshua High or New Horizon High School that is about to graduate, we'd love to learn more about them! Please send your child's name and a high-quality photo to jisdcommunications@joshuaisd.org. Please also send a list of extracurricular activities and accomplishments (maximum of 5 each), along with plans for after high school. #OFND #JoshuaStrong

post_text:
This afternoon, Texas Governor Greg Abbott issued a new Executive Order closing schools statewide for the remainder of the 2019-20 academic year due to the COVID-19 pandemic. JISD will still offer high-tech, low-tech curriculum & food services. District leaders are actively working on providing the community with more detailed information on plans moving forward. These details will be announced next week once finalized.

https://tinyurl.com/yapgrb22

Hundreds of business brands, chambers of commerce, education associations, universities, and other statewide and regional organizations have joined forces to honor teachers for their importance and impact. Joshua ISD is proud to be among those groups supporting the Teachers Can movement. Please share this video and visit TeachersCan.org to learn how you can help lift up our educators and say thank you to the teachers who made a difference in your life. And stay tuned for more soon!
#TeachersCan #TxEd

post_text:
High School students interested in postsecondary education can still learn more about colleges and universities of their choice during the COVID-19 closure.

College virtual tours allow students to visit campuses they are considering without leaving home! https://www.youvisit.com/collegesearch/

Students can also access virtual sessions to hear from admissions officers and gain important college knowledge. Sessions include college entrance exam information, how to make the most of your college visit, essay writing and finding the right college/major for you. Students must register for sessions they are interested in attending. More information can be found by clicking the links below.
https://www.askadvi.org/
https://www.strivescan.com/virtual/

🚨🚨INSTRUCTIONAL UPDATE: Effective today, Joshua ISD will be will now be accepting low tech instructional packets electronically in an effort to further protect the health of staff and community members. Packets can still be picked up on Thursdays. However, completed packets will now be submitted by taking a photo of the completed work on your phone and posting it to Google Classroom, Class DoJo, or Remind. This process will also give teachers more time to review the assignment and provide timely feedback. Learn more by clicking below: 👇
https://tinyurl.com/vjm2uj3

🚨🚨Joshua ISD students and families: Every Friday night from 8:30-9:30 pm, we will have our stadium lights on at Owl Stadium and Glen Holley Memorial Park as a symbol of hope for our students. The Owl Fight Song will also be played during this time. We encourage you to send photos of your view while the lights are on.

We would also like to see your Owl spirit by sending us your photos in your favorite Friday Night Spirit Gear! We will share these photos on the following Monday.

You are in our hearts and minds during this difficult time, and we will get through this together. #OFND 🦉

post_text:
Johnson County School Districts Extend Closure Through May 1
In support of a decision by Governor Greg Abbott to extend school closures across the state, all
Johnson County schools have announced they will remain closed through Friday, May 1.
• Alvarado
• Burleson
• Cleburne
• Godley
• Grandview
• Joshua
• Keene
• Rio Vista
• Venus
District offices will remain closed as well. School district leaders across the county will continue to monitor updates and recommendations from local officials, Governor Abbott and the Commissioner of Education as decisions are being made about instruction and any potential extension of the
closure.
These are unprecedented times and Johnson County school districts are appreciative of the patience and support given by their communities as they navigate their way through this new way of delivering instruction.

post_text:
As a result of the State of Disaster declaration from Texas Governor Greg Abbott due to the Coronavirus pandemic, Joshua ISD will livestream the regularly scheduled Board of Trustees meeting scheduled for Monday, March 30. The livestream will be available on the Joshua ISD Facebook page. This is in an effort to limit the number of people present to less than 10, per the guidelines of health organizations.

Anyone wishing to submit a comment on an agenda item or topic may do so by clicking on the link below. Comments will be accepted until the meeting begins at 6:30 pm. Comments will be read out to board during the public forum and public comment portions of the agenda. This will be the process for future board meetings until further notice. More information on public comments can also be found below.
https://tinyurl.com/vtunrjv

We want to see the quality time teachers and parents are spending with children as we continue to adapt to this new normal. Share your photos with us below using the hashtag #OwlsOnline

post_text:
Joshua ISD will be closed until April 9th, due to the most recently confirmed COVID-19 case in Johnson County. We plan to resume school on April 14th. During this time, JISD will provide both high-tech, and low-tech learning opportunities to students. The district will also offer wifi for students who do not have internet access at the parking lots of Caddo Grove Elementary and central administration. Additionally, JISD will provide free breakfast and lunch pickup delivery for all children each day at the Joshua High School Ninth Grade Center parking lot. All employees will continue to be compensated during this time. Please click on the link below for more information.
https://tinyurl.com/spco3cm

post_text: Congratulations to the Spirit Indoor Winds for their 2nd place finish at the WGI Dallas Regional last Saturday. This was only the group's 2nd competition in its history, and first time to compete on the International Circuit. You can catch the team's final performance tonight at Galbreath Gym, beginning at 7 pm. Due to concerns over Coronavirus, the remaining competitions have been canceled. We invite everyone to come out to see our Color Guard, Indoor Drumline, and Indoor Winds and celebrate the hard work of our students.

post_text: 1 pm UPDATE: Crews from Atmos Energy have shut off the gas line and it is safe for students and staff to return. Students will be transported back to Staples Elementary beginning at 2 pm. Normal afternoon dismissal procedures will take place. Club Excel and Open House this evening are still on as scheduled. Thank you again for your patience and cooperation during this time. And a big thank you to Dairy Queen for donating free hamburgers, fries and ice cream to our staff during the evacuation!
text: 1 pm UPDATE: Crews from Atmos Energy have shut off the gas line and it is safe for students and staff to return. Students will be transported back to Staples Elementary beginning at 2 pm. Normal afternoon dismissal procedures will take place. Club Excel and Open House this evening are still on as scheduled. Thank you again for your patience and cooperation during this time. And a big thank you to Dairy Queen for donating free hamburgers, fries and ice cream to our staff during the evacuation!

post_text: UPDATE: Atmos Energy is on scene and will work to repair the gas leak. There is no estimated time of when the leak will be fixed. All Staples Elementary students have been taken to the MPACT Center, and central administration staff are at the JISD Technology Center.
text: UPDATE: Atmos Energy is on scene and will work to repair the gas leak. There is no estimated time of when the leak will be fixed. All Staples Elementary students have been taken to the MPACT Center, and central administration staff are at the JISD Technology Center.

post_text:
We have been made aware of a gas leak near Staples
Elementary. Students are being evacuated immediately by bus to the MPACT Center, located directly behind Joshua High School. Lunches will be provided to students that have not had lunch yet. Parents may pick up and check out students at the MPACT Center starting at 12:30pm. Early pick up will not be counted as unexcused.
To ensure the safety of students, please allow us enough time to safely transport students.

We will send out updated information later this afternoon about regularly scheduled parent pickup, and plans for Open House.

Thank you for your patience and cooperation.

post_text: Joshua ISD 3rd Grader Natalie Prieto, 4th Grader Jocelyn Sandoval and 5th Grader Adriana Sanchez represented Joshua in the inaugural Spanish Spelling Bee at Region 11 on March 6th. Our students gave 100% in preparing for this competition and Natalie competed through the final round, placing 6th out of 40 students!

post_text:
Out of an abundance of caution, the Special Olympics Texas has postponed all activities until the end of March. This includes the inaugural Joshua ISD’s Special Olympics Meet, which was scheduled for tomorrow, March 11th, at Owl Stadium. This decision was carefully made in an effort to keep our students safe after reviewing the latest guidance from health organizations. For more information, visit the SOT website at www.sotx.org.

The meet will be rescheduled before the end of school on a date that has not been determined yet. Thank you for your continued support and cooperation as we work to reschedule the meet.

post_text: Come out and celebrate our new Joshua High School NJROTC electronic shooting range with a ribbon-cutting ceremony on Monday, March 9th at 5:30 pm at the ROTC wing. JHS is one of only two schools in Texas with this state-of-the-art system, which is the same one used in Olympic shooting competitions! The event will feature light refreshments, remarks from leaders, a facility tour, and a competition for everyone to see!

The event will feature light refreshments, remarks from leaders, a facility tour, and a competition for everyone to see!

67 students from Joshua High School totaled 70 regional medals at the Visual Arts Scholastic Event last weekend. Nine Owl students will be representing Joshua at the state VASE competition at San Marcos High School in April! Pieces that are not state-bound will be shown March 9th at Student Council's Gallery Night in the Fine Arts hallway. post_text: Joshua ISD will operate as normal today. Weather forecasts project our area to only receive rain, with temperatures above freezing.

post_text:
Joshua ISD leaders are continuing to monitor weather forecasts for the potential for inclement weather. Based on updates this afternoon from the National Weather Service, Johnson County is not currently expected to be impacted by severe conditions.
Student safety is our top priority. As a reminder, should JISD close for inclement weather, parents and staff will be notified at 5 a.m. via phone call, email and website post. The announcement will also be posted on the JISD Facebook and Twitter pages, and local media will be notified. As of now, all campuses remain on their regular schedules.
text:
Joshua ISD leaders are continuing to monitor weather forecasts for the potential for inclement weather. Based on updates this afternoon from the National Weather Service, Johnson County is not currently expected to be impacted by severe conditions.
Student safety is our top priority. As a reminder, should JISD close for inclement weather, parents and staff will be notified at 5 a.m. via phone call, email and website post. The announcement will also be posted on the JISD Facebook and Twitter pages, and local media will be notified. As of now, all campuses remain on their regular schedules.

post_text: UPDATE: North Joshua Elementary is no longer in a lockout.
text: UPDATE: North Joshua Elementary is no longer in a lockout.

post_text: Due to a domestic situation at Pinnacle Bank across from North Joshua Elementary, NJE is currently in a lockout. This means that school is carrying on as normal inside the building with no outside activities. For the safety of students and staff, no one, other than law enforcement officials, is allowed to enter the building.
text: Due to a domestic situation at Pinnacle Bank across from North Joshua Elementary, NJE is currently in a lockout. This means that school is carrying on as normal inside the building with no outside activities. For the safety of students and staff, no one, other than law enforcement officials, is allowed to enter the building.

post_text: Joshua ISD administrators are closely monitoring the inclement weather forecasted for Wednesday morning and will remain in contact with the Johnson County Emergency Management. A decision on a possible delay or cancellation will be determined early Wednesday morning, and the JISD community will be notified by a Skylert message. Notifications will also be posted on the district website and social media pages, and local media will be contacted.
text: Joshua ISD administrators are closely monitoring the inclement weather forecasted for Wednesday morning and will remain in contact with the Johnson County Emergency Management. A decision on a possible delay or cancellation will be determined early Wednesday morning, and the JISD community will be notified by a Skylert message. Notifications will also be posted on the district website and social media pages, and local media will be contacted.

post_text: Fourth graders from A.G. Elder Elementary traveled to Austin on an Education in Action Discover Texas Field Trip, on Thursday to experience what they are learning in Texas History. Students visited the Texas Ranger Hall of Fame and Museum in Waco, the Texas State Capitol, and the Bullock Texas State History Museum. Students also visited the Texas State Capitol where their legislators, The Honorable Brian Birdwell, State Senator, District 22 and The Honorable DeWayne Burns, State Representative, District 58, office. Students saw first-hand where Texas laws are made as they toured the State Capitol including the Senate and House of Representatives chambers.

post_text: Joshua High School Sophomore Parker Haydin traveled to TCU on January 11th to qualify for the National Junior Olympics in 10 Meter Air Rifle. Haydin needed a score of 575/600 Standing in order to gain automatic selection and fired a 580! He will travel to the Olympic Training Facility in Colorado Springs, Colorado next April to represent Texas and vie for a spot on the National Team.

"I am overwhelmed seeing my family from Oklahoma and former students here. Joshua ISD is my family. I've seen other school districts, and there is no other place I would rather be to spend the majority of my career."

R.C. Loflin Middle School celebrated the retirement of PE Coach Donna Mitchell! Coach Mitchell has spent the last 28 years in JISD teaching physical education; while coaching volleyball, track, tennis and basketball. Congratulations Coach Mitchell, and we wish you the best in your future endeavors!

post_text:
Joshua ISD was represented exceptionally well yesterday by our FFA Chapter at the Chisholm Trail District Leadership Development Events held at Cleburne High School. They took 36 students from the Ninth Grade and High School campuses and competed in 11 different events. This is an extremely competitive event that determines whether or not they advance to the next level of competition. Of the 11 teams that competed yesterday, 8 teams will be advancing to the Area VIII LDE contest on Saturday, November 23rd.
These students have put in countless hours of study time and preparation to make sure that their efforts came to fruition yesterday. On top of the students’ individual team successes, there is a Sweepstakes Award that is given to the school that collectively competed at the highest level in the 13 different competitions that are offered. Joshua FFA won the Sweepstakes award for the first time in Joshua FFA history!

This is Brian’s 3rd year to make an all-state organization as he also made the 5A All State Band two years ago, the 6A Philharmonic Orchestra last year, and now the All State Jazz Band. Brian will travel to San Antonio to perform a concert with this organization at the annual Texas Music Educators Association convention in February.

post_text:
The Joshua ISD Elementary Spelling Bee was held Wednesday, October 30, 2019 in the Joshua ISD Board Room. To advance to the district championship round, students had to initially place in a classroom level written spelling competition. The second level of qualifying required placing first in the campus oral spelling bee. Each school crowned a champion in third, fourth, and fifth grade. The three first place winners from each campus moved on to the district competition. We congratulate all students for their efforts and excellent spelling ability. All students represented their campus well.

The 2019 Spelling Bee Champion was Marleigh Embry, a third grader from Plum Creek Elementary.

post_text:
Did you know there is a difference between a Lockout and a Lockdown in terms of school safety?
A Lockout occurs when the threat is outside the building. All exterior doors are locked. Nobody is allowed in or out of the building to protect all staff and students. Parents are notified through Skylert.
A Lockdown occurs when the threat is inside the building. Due to the immediate threat, all doors (classrooms, offices, and exterior doors) are locked, lights are turned out, and students and staff are to hide out of sight of the windows in the room. Nobody is allowed in or out of rooms, offices, or the building. Only law enforcement should be in the hallways. Parents are notified through Skylert.
text:
Did you know there is a difference between a Lockout and a Lockdown in terms of school safety?
A Lockout occurs when the threat is outside the building. All exterior doors are locked. Nobody is allowed in or out of the building to protect all staff and students. Parents are notified through Skylert.
A Lockdown occurs when the threat is inside the building. Due to the immediate threat, all doors (classrooms, offices, and exterior doors) are locked, lights are turned out, and students and staff are to hide out of sight of the windows in the room. Nobody is allowed in or out of rooms, offices, or the building. Only law enforcement should be in the hallways. Parents are notified through Skylert.

post_text:
Caddo Grove Elementary collected an astounding $3,153.71 for Pennies for Patients! Pennies for Patients is a program sponsored by the Leukemia & Lymphoma society, a non-profit organization dedicated to finding cures for blood cancers.
Caddo Grove students were able to double the national average in collections, earning them the 2019-2020 LifeSaver School award! Congratulations Caddo Grove for your incredible generosity!

Joshua ISD cares about your child’s heart health, so they are partnering with the Cody Stephens Go Big or Go Home Memorial Foundation (GBOGH) to screen students with an ECG (electrocardiogram). An ECG, also known as an EKG, can detect issues in the heart that can be missed in a standard physical. Please consider signing up your child for this very important screening. The screenings will take place on September 18, 2019 starting at 4:00pm and are free to all JISD students in grades 7-12 that are in Athletics, Band, Dance, or Cheer that have turned in a UIL physical.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NgDYJCbD891YhBSEe7MPZqOaHsl-MCLn-RdAXNlI7UU/edit

JISD Earns an “A” Rating from TEA for 2019

We are proud to announce that JISD received an “A” rating by TEA under the new A-F Accountability System. This rating would not be possible without the hard work and dedication of all JISD staff, students, parents, and the community.
This rating reflects exemplary performance in three domains:
• Student Achievement
• School Progress
• Closing the Gaps
Our district vision states:
Joshua ISD will be a highly acclaimed model of educational excellence.
This rating exemplifies our commitment to educational excellence.
Use the link below if you are interested in further details about the district and school ratings, https://txschools.org/

post_text:
Elementary Robotics Competition

The 5th annual Joshua ISD elementary robotics competition was held on Thursday, May 2nd. The teams did an excellent job representing their campuses. The programming of the robots is very intense and the students showed their persistence in accomplishing the various tasks. The theme for this year was Charlie and the Chocolate Factory. There were three rounds of competition. The students first programmed the robots to Make a Gobstopper by pushing plastic blocks into the Gobstopper Maker. For the second round, the robots were programmed to gather fruit for the Lickable Wallpaper. In the final round, students took turns operating the robot remotely with an iPad to pop the bubbles in the Fizzy Lifting Chamber. The highest scoring team was from Caddo Grove Elementary, the Block Busters. Second place went to the Chocolate-etts and third place went to the Wonka Rockets. Both these teams were from Staples Elementary. Congratulations to all the students who participated. It was an amazing day!

post_text:
Owl and Lady Owl Soccer Teams Advance to Bi-District Playoffs

Both Owl and Lady Owl soccer teams will be playing bi-district playoff games this week. Here are the details:

Boys:
The District 14-5A runner-up Owls return to the playoffs this year coming off the best district finish in school history. The reward for their work is a first round matchup with North Forney, the 3rd seed from District 13-5A. The game will be this Friday (Mar. 29) at 8 PM at Lancaster’s Beverly D. Humphrey Tiger Stadium.

Girls:
The District 14-5A runner-up Lady Owls enter playoffs this week as well. This is the eighth straight year the Lady Owls have been a top 2 district seed, and they will face Terrell (the 3rd seed from District 13-5A) in the bi-district round. The Lady Owls and Lady Tigers will face off this Thursday (Mar. 28) at 6 PM at DeSoto’s Eagle Stadium.

We look forward to seeing you Thursday night in DeSoto and Friday night in Lancaster!

Congratulations to JISD State Weightlifting Winners

Congratulations to Brek Galbreath, Blake Edgington, and Coach Andrew Junior! Brek Galbreath won the STATE CHAMPIONSHIP and Blake Edgington placed 3rd at the state powerlifting meet Saturday! As a team the Joshua Owls finished 5th place out of 121 schools.

Brek Galbreath
State Champion in the 198 Weight Class
605 LB Squat
435 LB Bench (New State Record in 198 Weight Class)
625 LB Dead Lift
1665 Total

Blake Edgington
3rd Place in 242 Weight Class
640 LB Squat
420 LB Bench
605 LB Dead Lift
1665 Total

Joshua Owls finished 5th in Division 1 out of 121 schools represented. Division 1 includes both 5A and 6A Schools.

Brek Galbreath
State Champion in the 198 Weight Class
605 LB Squat
435 LB Bench (New State Record in 198 Weight Class)
625 LB Dead Lift
1665 Total

Blake Edgington
3rd Place in 242 Weight Class
640 LB Squat
420 LB Bench
605 LB Dead Lift
1665 Total

Joshua Owls finished 5th in Division 1 out of 121 schools represented. Division 1 includes both 5A and 6A Schools.

If you think your child is feeling “stressed out”, please talk to your student. If you need assistance, please call their school counselor.

post_text:
FFA Livestock Judging Team wins San Angelo and San Antonio!

The Joshua FFA Livestock Judging Team has had some recent success this spring. They were the Champion Team at the San Angelo Stock Show out of 38 teams. Rhianna Adkins was the 2nd high point individual and Mayson Campbell was the 7th high point individual. They were also named the Champion Team at the San Antonio Stock Show out of 210 teams. Rhianna Adkins was the high point individual out of 696 contestants and received a $10,000 scholarship from the San Antonio Livestock Show.

Team members include:
Rhianna Adkins
Catherine Murphey
Molly Hicks
Grant Cox
Mayson Campbell

post_text: Did you know…Spring is a very stressful time for students with STAAR tests and extracurricular activities. One sign of childhood or teen stress is when a student begins to withdraw from friends or isolate himself/herself. If you think your child is feeling “stressed out,” please talk to your student. If you need assistance, please call their school counselor.

post_text:
Joshua High School Policy Debaters won 1st place, 3rd place and 4th place at UIL 5A District 14 Policy Debate competition Friday, February 1 in Midlothian. They competed against teams from Cleburne, Corsicana, Ennis, Midlothian and Red Oak.
1st place team, sisters, Cassidy Carey (Senior) and Camryn Carey (Sophomore) won first place in District and will advance to the State Tournament in Austin March 22-23.
The team of Luke Boyce (Senior) and Gabby Wood (Junior) won 3rd place (Alternates to State)
The team of Juniors, Ben Guerrero and Cail Keeling won 4th place.
Luke Boyce received the award for top speaker in District 5A-14.

post_text: Joshua ISD Elementary schools held their annual UIL competition on January 23, 2019. We had 486 students compete in 13 academic categories for first, second, and third place awards. On January 24, 2019 an awards ceremony was held at Acker Auditorium to honor the students’ successes. Our staff is very proud of the teamwork, dedication, and commitment to excellence each student displayed during the competition. Congratulations to all of our UIL participants!! Thank you, District and Campus Administrators, Staff, Coordinators, Coaches, Teachers, Community Volunteers, and our JHS Drumline, JHS Sweetheart Dance Team, and JHS Cheerleaders for making this a memorable event for our students and their families!

Congratulations to the following members of the Spirit of Joshua who earned seats in the TMEA Region 30 All Region Band on Saturday, December 15th.
Nathaniel Vallejo made the 5A/6A Freshmen Band. Alyssa Trahan, Yahvi Suhalka, Allie Brown, Mathew Hull, Logan Purcell, Colton Padgett, and Chris Cuellar all made the 5A Concert Band. Tia Chernow, McKenna Garcia, and Jaydon Frazier all made the 5A Symphonic Band. Brian Bodine made the 6A Symphonic Band. In addition, Brian Bodine and Jaydon Frazier earned spots at the Area auditions to be held on January 12th to compete for seats in the TMEA All State Band.

post_text:
Did you know that Joshua ISD Elementary students will participate in STEAM week during the first week of December? STEAM stands for Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, and Math. The theme will be “Mission to Mars.” Students will complete activities in class aligned to STEAM and will have the opportunity to interact with a giant map of Mars. Students will use critical thinking skills to analyze the surface of Mars to help guide “space travelers” to a safe landing. In addition, students will start off this experience by watching the video below which will set the stage and create the excitement of visiting the Mars Map when it arrives on their home campus.
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ktpQIbvcGvTXR43SAujTcmj9FfpHuqY5/view?usp=sharing

post_text: Did you know that JISD hosts a Plan Your Path field trip for all 8th graders? The purpose of this field trip is for 8th grade students to be able to visit facilities and learn about programs offered at our Ninth Grade Center and Joshua High School. This is an exciting day for our NGC and JHS to showcase their programs and for our 8th grade students to see what they have to look forward to. This day also gives students insight for endorsement and pathway options. The Plan Your Path field trip is on Wednesday, November 14th at NGC and JHS.

post_text:
District Spelling Bee Contest

The Joshua ISD Elementary Spelling Bee was held Friday, November 2, 2018, at the Joshua ISD Board Room. To advance to the district championship round students had to initially place in a classroom level written spelling competition. The second level of qualifying required placing first in the campus oral spelling bee. Each school crowned a champion in third, fourth, and fifth grade. The three first place winners from each campus moved on to the district competition. We congratulate all students for their efforts and excellent spelling ability. All students represented their campus well.

The 2018 Spelling Bee Champion was Abigail Camp, a fifth grader from Caddo Grove Elementary.

post_text:
JHS Robotics Wins BEST Rookies

The JHS Robotics Team attended the 2018 Cowtown
BEST Robotics Competition on October 27 at Arlington Lamar High School. BEST stands for Boosting Engineering, Science, and Technology. The team did an outstanding job and won the BEST Rookies of the Year award. The team is coached by Aaron King, who teaches Chemistry, Engineering and Robotics at JHS. Congratulations to all of the students who are part of the JHS Robotics Team for a job well done.

Loflin Band Students earn Honor Band Membership

The Loflin Middle School Band recently competed in an invitational honor band where the LMS students competed against students from 9 middle schools in order to earn a place in the Honor Band. We are pleased to announce that five students from LMS earned a chair and will be participating in the honor band with a special guest clinician. Congratulations to Isabella Kirchmann, Mercy Lewis, Jaxon Dial, Tibor Hollmann, and Emma King on earning a coveted chair in the 2018 Honor Band!

JHS Lady Owls Volleyball are Area Champions

Rylie Rumsfield 5 kills and 9 digs

post_text: Did you know that “Shoes for Kids” is a program that the Joshua High School Student Council has been doing for about 15 years? It started out with the Student Council buying just a few pair of shoes for some of our JISD elementary students and has since evolved to the point where they are buying 100 pair of new shoes and socks for our students each year. The Student Council takes 50 Pre-K through 2ndgrade students to Payless Shoe Store and then gives them a high school buddy to help them pick out any pair of shoes, boots, or tennis shoes they want. After shopping for shoes, they all head to McDonalds for lunch and play time in the play area. For 3rd through 5th grade students, the Student Council sends paperwork home to gather information about shoe size and the type of shoes needed. After receiving the paperwork back, the student council officers shop for the shoes and then deliver them to campuses. Watching how excited the elementary students are when they get their new shoes makes this event all worthwhile for our Joshua High School Student Council.

post_text: In an effort to ensure timely transportation for students who ride the bus to school and prevent students from standing outside during inclement weather, First Student has a scheduled time when the bus will be at the bus stop assigned for your child in the mornings. If you do not know the time they are expected to be at the bus stop, please call First Student at 817-556-0412 and speak to a member of their staff. Beginning next week, buses will not be returning to pick up students who are not at the bus stop when the bus arrives on time. Parents will need to make arrangements to get their child to school if they miss the bus.

post_text: Did you know that Joshua ISD is a Project Adam Certified District? There are only 8 districts ,including Joshua ISD, in the state of Texas who are Project Adam Certified. In order to receive a Project Adam District Certification, each campus within the district must have an emergency team trained annually in the use of AEDs, each campus must have an emergency plan for sudden cardiac events, and each campus must have AEDs strategically located.

Update: The Band UIL competition scheduled to occur in Owl Stadium on Tuesday, October 16 has been postponed until Monday October 22 due to weather.
On Tuesday, October 16, Joshua ISD will host the Region 30 UIL 5A/6A Marching Competition at Joshua High School. 19 bands from around the area will be present on that day to compete. Due to the large number of schools attending, we will have to reroute parent pick up on that day. All parents will pick up students in the north parking lot near the softball and baseball fields. We will have detour signs posted to help facilitate this change. Please come out and support The Spirit of Joshua when they perform at 8:00 pm. Admission is $5.00 for adults and $3.00 for students. Thank you in advance for your help in easing congestion in our parking areas and supporting our students in their performance.

post_text: Did you know that each Joshua ISD campus has designated “safe rooms” for severe weather events that occur during the school day? The safe rooms are marked with signs next to the door that say, “Tornado Safe Area” with a picture of a tornado above the wording. Also, there are signs and maps in the hallways directing students to these “safe rooms.” The rooms chosen as “safe rooms” are interior rooms in the building that are surrounded by other rooms for protection.

Paperless Report Cards Coming to JISD

In an effort to conserve natural and financial resources, Joshua ISD will be transitioning to paperless report cards and progress reports for all students. Beginning the second six weeks, all report cards and progress reports will be accessed online through Skyward Family Access.

Instructions about how to access your student's progress reports and report cards is being sent home with your student's first six weeks report card on tomorrow, October 4. Please be sure to look for these important instructions so that you will be ready for the electronic posting of the second six weeks progress report.

For a copy of the instructions click on the links below.

https://tinyurl.com/PaperlessReportCards

After the presenting of colors, the Rifle team presented their magnificent rifle routine. Master Chief Linville then spoke to students about the opportunities the Naval Junior ROTC program provides for students and that they could join the program when they enter high school. It was also Patriot Day for our Healthy Awareness Lifestyle week. Students and staff dressed in red, white and blue to remember this important day in history.

post_text:
Homecoming 2018
The Joshua Owls will be playing the Lake Worth Bullfrogs on Friday, Sept. 7th at 7:30pm.

Parade
The homecoming parade will be Monday, Sept 3rd at 6:00 pm. Anyone wanting to enter a float in the parade will need to pick up an application in the front office at the high school.

The parade will begin at ATMOS Energy and follow the route used in previous years, ending up at the stadium where there will be a brief community pep rally introducing the Grand Marshal, Coming Home Queen and the Homecoming Court along with the Spirit of Joshua Band, The JHS Sweethearts, and Cheer.

This year’s Grand Marshal is Mick Cochran and the Coming Home Queen is Debbie Gibson Aiken.

Alumni Tent
As in previous years, the JHS Alumni Committee will have a canopied seating area in the north parking lot for members to enjoy the parade.

Brylea Bensen Named Outstanding Performer at Band Contest

Congratulations to Brylea Bensen for being selected as an outstanding performer at the 2018 Texas State Solo-Ensemble Keyboard Percussion Solo Contest. Of the approximately 100,000 students participating in the regional UIL music contests and the 25,000 musicians who performed at TSSEC, only 2%-3% of the solo performances earned the distinguished honor of being recognized as an outstanding performer.

A PARENT Family Access Account is required for Online Annual Registration. The legal parent/guardian who will be completing the Online Annual Registration for a returning student must have a Skyward Family Access account in order to access the online registration area. Most parents already have this account, but anyone needing a Skyward Family Access account must obtain one before the end of this school year.

You will not be able to register your returning student for the 2018-19 without a PARENT Skyward Family Access account and complete Proof of Residency. Please note that you will not be able to use your child’s Student Access account to complete online registration.

Be sure to contact your campus’ registrar before the end of this school year if you need a Family Access account or you have forgotten your account information.

The legal parent/guardian who will be completing the Online Annual Registration for a returning student must have a Skyward Family Access account in order to access the online registration area. Most parents already have this account, but anyone needing a Skyward Family Access account must obtain one before the end of this school year.

You will not be able to register your returning student for the 2018-19 without a PARENT Skyward Family Access account and complete Proof of Residency. Please note that you will not be able to use your child’s Student Access account to complete online registration.

Be sure to contact your campus’ registrar before the end of this school year if you need a Family Access account or you have forgotten your account information.

post_text:
Nichols MS Band to Premier New Music by Acclaimed Composer Randall Standridge

The Nichols MS Symphonic Band was accepted as a part of a consortium this semester to work with acclaimed composer Randall Standridge on the development of a brand new piece of music. The band has gotten a behind the scenes look at the process through video correspondence and have had the opportunity to ask questions. This has been a very unique learning opportunity. The band will premier this new work (not currently available to other bands!) at Saturday nights Honor Band Concert featuring the Nichols MS Symphonic Band, Loflin MS Symphonic Band and JHS Honor Band. Concert will be held at Acker Auditorium at 7 pm this Saturday, May 19.

post_text:
JHS Cheer Competition Results

JHS Varsity Cheer competed in Frisco, on February 6, at the Redline Cheer Championships. Scoring above 90% of the max score, the team members won jackets and rings.

JHS’s Special Needs cheer team also performed at the Reline Cheer Championships. They were awarded medals and Championship jackets. They were great! There were thousands of cheerleaders at this event. Redline chose five who, in their opinion “lit up the floor.” Breaun Whitley, a member of JHS’s Special Needs cheer team was one of the five. This award has never been given to a special needs participant, but the judges were overwhelmed by her performance and named her one of the five. She received a cheer backpack donate by Rebel Athletics.

Lady Owls Soccer Team Advances to Regional Quarterfinals

On Friday the Lady Owls Soccer Team defeated Mansfield Lake Ridge 3-0 in the regional quarterfinal, securing a berth in the regional tournament. This is the Lady Owls’ first-ever regional tournament appearance—fantastic work from our ladies!

The team will advance to the regional semifinal round of playoffs, where they will face Frisco Wakeland, from district 13-5A. This game will take place Friday, April 13, at Standridge Stadium in Carrollton. Game time is 12:30 PM. The team hopes to see you there!

post_text:
Nichols MS Band Earns Top Awards at UIL

The Nichols MS Symphonic Band got off to an excellent start in the 2018 UIL Concert & Sight reading competition. They earned a first division rating (superior) in both the concert and sight reading portions of the contest earning them a Sweepstakes award. Sweepstakes is the highest award given to a middle school band by UIL. They were also one of only a handful of bands (in two days of performances) to earn a first division rating from every single judge on the panel. They have set the bar high for the future of the program and have started a tradition of excellence that is expected for many years to come.

During our Safe Employee Recognition Campaign for Spring 2018, employees were eligible to receive a scratch-off card if they met all four of the below criteria between December 1, 2017 thru February 15, 2018:

1. No at-fault accidents
2. Attend all safety training meetings
3. Daily use of slip-resistant footwear
4. Consistent use of Personal Protective Equipment items: Eye protection, gloves, knee pads, hearing protection, etc.

Winners were from each of our auxiliary departments, Child Nutrition, Custodial and Maintenance.

post_text:
Congratulations to JHS Cheer Teams

On March 4, the JHS competition cheer team performed at their first competition. It was held at the University of North Texas. The team impressed the judges and was offered an opportunity to perform at a Dallas Mavericks basketball game. These students not only shine on the competition mat; they are great representatives of JISD in the classroom and in the community. They are part of what makes JHS a wonderful place to be.

The JHS Special Needs Cheer team also made its debut on March 4, at the University of North Texas! The JHS Varsity cheer team has partnered with 10 life skills students to create this team. This team has been beneficial to all involved. Mrs. Paul could not be prouder of her cheerleaders for their genuine enthusiasm in this endeavor. The joy is evident on the faces of these kids as they perform.

You can view videos of both teams' performances by clicking on the link below.

https://tinyurl.com/JHScompetitioncheerteam

post_text:
JHS UIL One-Act Play Advances to Next Round

Congratulations to the cast and crew of The Crucible. The UIL One-Act Play presented by Joshua High School Advanced last night and will be competing in the next round on March 22nd at 7pm at Lake Ridge High School in Arlington. The cast and crew did a terrific job and brought home many awards. The Tech Crew consisting of Allie Sanders, Zane Hairston, Brant Robbins, Cayse Chambers, and Annabel Beam received the ALL Star Tech Award. Zane Hairston received an All Star Tech Award, Alex Lanning received an Honorable Mention All Star Cast Award; Abbie Beam received an All Star Cast Award, Kendal Stanley received the Best Actress Award, and Elan Sealy received the Best Actor Award! The student have put in countless hours to get to this point. Please congratulate all of The Crucible One-Act Play Company.

JOSHUA ISD SPRING KINDERGARTEN REGISTRATION FOR THE 2018 – 2019 SCHOOL YEAR

If your child turns 5 on or before September 1, 2018, you may register him/her this spring for kindergarten at the elementary campus he/she will be attending. The spring registration dates are as follows: April 23 – April 27, 2018 from 8:30 -11:30 and 1:00-3:00 p.m. Each campus will extend registration hours until 6 p.m. on Tuesday, April 24, 2018. Please call the office of the campus your child will be attending and make an appointment to register your child. To find out the campus your child will be attending, you can call the Joshua ISD administration office at 817-202-2500 or metro 817-426-7500 ext. 1041. The campus extension numbers are as follows: Caddo Grove Elementary 1589, Elder Elementary 1689, North Joshua Elementary 1789, Plum Creek Elementary 1889, and Staples Elementary 1989.

post_text:
Saturday, February 3rd, the Sweethearts and the Royal Belles competed at Crowd Pleasers dance competition.
The Sweetheart had three girls compete solo routines: Abby Mitchell won the 10th grade division and April Johnson and Mecca Halbert received Division I's in their division. The dance officers placed first in all of their routines bringing home a super sweepstakes and Grand Champion Awards. The team also competed and brought home Super Sweepstakes, Showcase Elite and Grand Champion!
The Royal Belles team won best in class jazz, best in class novelty and best in class pom. They received a super sweepstakes and judges award. Zoey Brumit placed 3rd in her solo and Zoey Frisby placed 2nd in her solo. The team brought home the Grand Champion Team banner and trophy! Way to go Royal Belles!

post_text: Joshua ISD Elementary schools held their annual UIL competition on January 24, 2018. 450 students prepared to compete in 11 academic categories for first, second, and third place awards. On January 25, 2018 an awards ceremony was held at Acker Auditorium to honor the students’ successes. Our staff is very proud of the teamwork, dedication, and commitment to excellence each student displayed during the competition. Congratulations to all of our UIL participants!! Thank you, District and Campus Administrators, Staff, Coordinators, Coaches, Teachers, Community Volunteers, and our JHS Drumline, JHS Sweetheart Dance Team, and JHS Cheerleaders for making this a memorable event for our students and their families!

post_text: Cadet Grace Sharp competed in the Texas Junior Olympics for 10 Meter Air Rifle at TCU on January 13th. Sharp turned in an impressive 390/400 in the STANDING Position and secured an automatic qualification for the National Junior Olympics to be held in Colorado Springs next April. One NCAA female athlete scored higher, but Grace is only 15.

post_text:
January is School Board Recognition Month

January 2018 is School Board Recognition Month—a great time to focus on the crucial role an elected board of trustees plays in our communities and schools.

Plan now to show your school board members you appreciate their dedication and hard work. They are extraordinary people who voluntarily tackle the enormous job of governing school districts. Their actions and decisions affect the present and future lives of our children.

Recognizing board members for this commitment and sacrifice takes a combined effort on the part of all those they serve: administrators, school staff, students, and the community. Although showing appreciation should be a year-round process, taking advantage of the designated School Board Recognition Month in January assures that these important people receive some of the thanks they deserve.

Board members serving JISD are: Ronnie Galbreath, President, Myra Pruitt, Vice President, Gene Loflin, Secretary, Chris Ohlsen, Donny McCoy, Jason Moss and Taffy Ward.

post_text:
The Fall 2017 Safe Employee Recognition Campaign has come to a close for our Auxiliary departments. The employees had to meet the following criteria and were given a scratch off card. The winners received a stadium seat cushion.
1. No at-fault accidents
2. Attend all safety training meetings
3. Daily use of slip-resistant footwear
4. Consistent use of Personal Protective Equipment items: Eye protection, gloves, knee pads, hearing protection, etc.

post_text:
Joshua ISD District Science Fair Competition
During the week of November 27th – December 1st, each elementary campus held their annual science fair competition. The first place winners in 1st-5th grades went on to compete at the JISD District science fair competition conducted on December 7th. Students in 5th grade conducted an experiment requiring them to pose a question, develop a hypothesis, follow through with data, and draw a conclusion. Students in 1st – 4th selected a project from collections, models, or cycles. Each contestant presented their Science Fair project boards and gave an oral presentation to a judge during the interview portion of the competition.

Students in 1st – 4th selected a project from collections, models, or cycles. Each contestant presented their Science Fair project boards and gave an oral presentation to a judge during the interview portion of the competition.

post_text: Fifty three (53) students from Joshua ISD participated in the Burleson Friends Festival which was held on November 7th at Elk Stadium in Burleson ISD. The student athletes competed with students from many neighboring school districts in a variety of track and field events such as: relay races, obstacle courses, football toss, bowling, soccer kick, and mini golf. The students displayed excellent sportsmanship and participated enthusiastically. All students did an excellent job of representing Joshua ISD and we are very proud of their accomplishments. We also want to express appreciation to the teachers, staff, student helpers and parents from each campus who chaperoned the event. A huge thank you to the cheerleaders and mascots who attended and provided school spirit. A special thank you to Ethan Mallory from Mallory’s Print Shop in Joshua. He donated t-shirts for all the athletes and sponsors!

post_text:
District Spelling Bee Contest

The Joshua ISD Elementary Spelling Bee was held Friday, November 3, 2017, at the Joshua ISD Board Room. To advance to the district championship round students had to initially place in a classroom level written spelling competition. The second level of qualifying required placing first in the campus oral spelling bee. Each school crowned a champion in third, fourth, and fifth grade. The three first place winners from each campus moved on to the district competition. We congratulate all students for their efforts and excellent spelling ability. All students represented their campus well.

The 2017 Spelling Bee Champion was Abigail Camp, a fourth grader from Caddo Grove Elementary.

post_text: Joshua High School and Donate Life Texas are teaming up to bring you an event to honor Aaron Singleton. Aaron and his family were able to donate his organs so that others may live. Donate Life Texas and Joey Gase use the platform of NASCAR to bring awareness to organ donation. They will unveil his car that he is driving in the AAA Texas 500 on November 5. Aaron’s picture will be on the car and his friends and family will be allowed to paint handprints on the car. This also marks the one year anniversary of Aaron’s passing. Please join us to help celebrate the lives of those fortunate to receive organ donations on Thursday, November 2 at JHS Owl Stadium from 10:30 to 11:00 am. If you have any questions call JHS at 817-202-2500 ext. 1100.

post_text: Officer Rojas, one of the new Johnson County Sheriff deputies assigned to JISD, spoke with Caddo Grove Elementary 1st graders. First, they had to promise to be good citizens and then they were sworn in as official Johnson County Sheriff deputies. They even got a badge to stick on their shirt. Officer Rojas then told them how important first responders are and how they help people in need. He also shared a story with them about police officers. Thank you Officer Rojas and welcome to JISD!

post_text:
"Hoot Owl-ley" scheduled for Friday, September 1

JISD is hosting our 5th Annual Community Health and Wellness Fair at our very own Owl Stadium! Physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual health are all invaluable to the overall wellness of our community members. Come learn about ways to be more health aware! Hoot Owl-ley is our JISD Health and Wellness Fair held at the Owl Stadium. Many organizations from across the county will be represented! There will also be KidZone games for our students. Come learn more about services that are available to you in Joshua!

Participants include:
Joshua Chiropractic
Cleburne Eye Clinic
Family Crisis Center
YMCA- Joshua
CareFlite
Joshua Spine
Camp Gladiator
YoungLife
And MANY MORE!!!!!
Football game tickets are $4 for students and $7 for adults at all JISD campuses and are available for $8 at the gate and are valid for both events!

post_text:
A PARENT Family Access Account is required for Online Annual Registration. The legal parent/guardian who will be completing the Online Annual Registration for a returning student must have a Skyward Family Access account in order to access the online registration area. Most parents already have this account, but anyone needing a Skyward Family Access account must obtain one before the end of this school year.

You will not be able to register your returning student for the 2017-18 without a PARENT Skyward Family Access account or complete Proof of Residency. Please note that you will not be able to use your child’s Student Access account to complete online registration.

Be sure to contact your campus’ registrar before the end of this school year if you need a Family Access account or you have forgotten your account information.

Thank you.

post_text: Plum Creek Elementary School volunteers were invited April 26, 2017 to our annual luncheon in honor of their service to our school. Invitations were sent to our parents and community members that devote many hours of service helping our teachers and students. We had baked potatoes, soup, and a salad bar for everyone to enjoy. Also Plum Creek’s staff brought a variety of desserts and snacks. Door prizes were handed out throughout the luncheon. Each volunteer took home gifts of thanks for their service, time and effort. The volunteers ate with their teachers, enjoyed each other’s company and had a good time. We treasure our volunteers and appreciate all they do for us. It is a pleasure to treat them to lunch & show them how much we appreciate their time and service to our school.
text: Plum Creek Elementary School volunteers were invited April 26, 2017 to our annual luncheon in honor of their service to our school. Also Plum Creek’s staff brought a variety of desserts and snacks. Door prizes were handed out throughout the luncheon. Each volunteer took home gifts of thanks for their service, time and effort. The volunteers ate with their teachers, enjoyed each other’s company and had a good time. We treasure our volunteers and appreciate all they do for us. It is a pleasure to treat them to lunch & show them how much we appreciate their time and service to our school.

post_text: The Caddo Grove Elementary Student Council recognized some special Johnson County Sheriff’s department officers. Officer Tharpe, Officer Kinman, Officer Collins and Officer Herod help keep Caddo Grove Elementary safe. Student Council presented them with a thermal cup to keep their beverages at the perfect temperature. Officer Kinman, Officer Collins and Officer Herod are outside directing traffic every day no matter the weather conditions. Officer Tharpe is our School Resource Officer and is always ready to lend a helping hand. Thank you for all of your support!!!

Officer Tharpe is our School Resource Officer and is always ready to lend a helping hand. Thank you for all of your support!!!

post_text: Five hundred students from Caddo Grove Elementary in Joshua ISD and Santa Fe Elementary in Cleburne ISD received new shoes on March 31. Tommy Vasquez from the Wal-Mart Distribution Center put the schools in contact with the Samaritan’s Feet Organization. Between the two groups, they provided shoes, socks and provided some of the volunteers. The rest of the volunteers were parents from the schools and Joshua High School Student Council members. The volunteers washed the student’s feet and then put a new pair of socks and shoes on them. There were a lot of smiling faces as students ran off in their new shoes.

post_text:
The Lady Owl soccer team claimed the area championship Friday night with a 5-0 win over Dallas Adams. This is the third area championship in school history—a great achievement for our ladies!
Also, details have been set for our District 9-5A champion, bi-district champion, and area champion Lady Owl soccer regional quarterfinal game. We will face off with Mansfield Legacy and again are very excited at the opportunity to continue playing. This game will take place this Tuesday, April 4, at 7:00 PM at Crowley High School.

post_text: There are 3,500 JROTC units nationwide, representing the Army, Navy, Air Force, and Marines. The top shooters from each branch of the service converged on Anniston, Alabama March 24-25 for the All Service Nationals. Less than 200 shooters made it to this level. Cadet Patrick Cummins was at the event to represent his school, his State, and the United States Navy. Cadet Cummins was 2nd in Sporter Class for Texas last December and became a Junior Distinguish Gold shooter at the Navy Nationals last February.

Joshua ISD Spring Kindergarten Registration for 2017-2018

If your child turns 5 on or before September 1, 2017, you may register him/her this spring for kindergarten at the elementary campus he/she will be attending. The spring registration dates are as follows: April 24 – April 28, 2017 from 8:30 -11:30 and 1:00-3:00 p.m. Each campus will extend registration hours until 6 p.m. on Tuesday, April 25, 2017. Please call the office of the campus your child will be attending and make an appointment to register your child.

To find out the campus your child will be attending, you can call the Joshua ISD administration office at 817-202-2500 or metro 817-426-7500 ext. 1041. The campus extension numbers are as follows: Caddo Grove Elementary 1589, Elder Elementary 1689, North Joshua Elementary 1789, Plum Creek Elementary 1889, and Staples Elementary 1989.

post_text:
Last month Joshua High School hosted a UIL Academic, Speech and Debate tournament. The tournament attracted over 500 students representing 23 area schools. The tournament was a huge success and is used as a fundraiser to supplement our own JHS students who compete in Academics, Speech and Debate.
In preparing for the tournament, JHS received donations from several local businesses and many individuals. They would like to take this opportunity to thank the many parents, teachers and staff who donated both their time and food items to the event. JHS would also like to thank the following businesses for their donations: Chicken Express of Joshua, Napoli's, Domino's Pizza of Joshua, Star Donut, Chik-Fil-A of Burleson (John Jones), and Awards by Mastercraft of Burleson. Your donations made an enormous impact on the success of our tournament. Thank-you!

shared_text:
Joshua ISD added 27 new photos.
January 31, 2017 at 3:32 PM ·

Joshua ISD Elementary schools held their 13th annual UIL competition on January 25, 2017. Over 500 students competed in 10 academic categories for first, second, and third place awards. On January 26, 2017 an awards ceremony was held at Acker Auditorium to honor the students’ successes. JISD is very proud of the teamwork, dedication, and commitment to excellence each student displayed during the competition. Congratulations to all of our UIL participants!! Thank you, District and Campus Administrators, Staff, Coordinators, Coaches, Teachers, Community Volunteers, and our JHS Drum line, JHS Sweetheart Dance Team, and JHS Cheerleaders for making this a memorable event for our students and their families!!
