post_text:
Over three decades ago, Drum Corp International was formed to allow young musicians the opportunity to expand their skills through playing, pageantry and artistry across the globe.
Through the annual DCI Tour and World Championships, Drum Corps International provides entertainment to millions through live performances and nationally-broadcast events.
Each year over 10,000 young musicians audition for Corps in just America alone.
Students from 15 different countries annually audition for a Drum and Bugle Corp.
One of these prestigious Drum and Bugle Corps is the Crossmen based in San Antonio, Texas.
Joshua HS junior, Parker Wiley, auditioned for the Crossmen this spring. After receiving callbacks, Parker was awarded a position in the Crossmen on trumpet.
In their nearly 40-year history, the Crossmen have reached the DCI finals 26 times!
With Parker in their ranks, we look forward to seeing them rise to the top tier once again.
Congratulations Parker!!!

Joshua High School senior, Alexia Dela Cruz earned a spot in the “TEXAS ALL-STATE CHOIR”

She has been working since August and has succeeded in 4 separate auditions (September, October, November & January).

She earned 2nd chair competing against singers from Plano, Keller, Arlington, Mansfield, Birdville, Fort Worth, Granbury, Weatherford and others.

Congratulations on this high honor.

She will be performing for 3 days in February in San Antonio with the other All-State members from all over Texas.

post_text:
Texas Academic Performance Report Public Hearing Notice

Monday, January 23, 2017
6:30 PM

Board Room of JISD Administration Building
310 E. 18th Street
Joshua, Texas 76058

Texas Academic Performance Report (TAPR)

Notice is hereby given that the Joshua Independent School District Board of Trustees will hold a hearing for public discussion of the 2015-2016 Texas Academic Performance Report (TAPR). The hearing will be held on January 23, 2017 at 6:30 PM in the Board Room at the JISD Administration Building. The purpose of the hearing is to review district and campus student performance on the TAPR indicators and to provide descriptive information for the district and state on students, staff and finance. All district patrons and interested parties are welcome and encouraged to attend.

For additional information about the public hearing, please contact Chris Taylor at 817-202-2500 or 817-426-7500.

The Board of Trustees will convene in a regular monthly session immediately following the public meeting.

post_text: Caddo Grove Elementary has been busy helping others in need this holiday season. Students wrote letters to Santa for the Macy’s Make a Wish Believe Campaign. Over 550 students wrote letters to Santa and placed a stamp on the envelope. They were delivered by 2nd graders to the red mailbox at Macy’s, where Macy’s will donate $1 for each letter to the Make a Wish Foundation. Students also raised money for the local Bikes for Angels charity. Each hallway competed to see who could bring in the largest amount of money for the organization and our 1st and 2nd graders were the winners but the true winners will be the kids that will receive these bikes this holiday season. Lastly, students brought in new and gently used clothes for the Common Threads Clothing store which is run by Elder Elementary’s PTSO. It will be open December 17th from 8 am to 5 pm for JISD families to select clothing at no cost. It is located behind Joshua High School. We would like to thank our CGE families for their generous donations.

post_text:
Joshua ISD District Science Fair Competition
During the week of November 28th – December 2nd, each elementary campus held their annual science fair competition. The first, second, and third place winners in 6th grade and first place winners in 1st -5th went on to compete at the JISD District science fair on December 8th. Students in 5th and 6th grade conducted an experiment requiring them to pose a question, develop a hypothesis, follow through with data, and draw a conclusion. Students in 1st -4th selected a project from collections, models, or cycles. Each contestant presented their Science Fair project boards and gave an oral presentation to a judge during the interview portion of the competition.
The 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place winners from the sixth grade category will have the opportunity to compete at the 66th Fort Worth Regional Science and Engineering Fair at the College Park Events Center at UTA in Arlington on February 19-20. Winners from the regional competition will proceed to the state competition.
